author: Willy
content:
With Doug Bostrom. I finured to marine growth the blades may have been treated with the anti-fouling paint (propspeed) of (youtube channel) Sailing Zatarra.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KJ2L_ezyxuA

author: Doug Bostrom
content:
And bio-fouling, Willy.

There was a project that ran here in the Pacific NW. Now I’m curious to see how that turned out, in terms of critters growing on the equipment.

Certainly a more challenging environment that for wind turbines, all things considered.

author: Willy
content: How well will they generate when fouled with gill netting?

author: Doug Bostrom
content:
Leaving aside bigger grid applications, these could certainly be a problem solver in many isolated locales with communities needing a fully local utility.

Combined with pumped hydro*, a complete system. I can think of a dozen islands off the top of my head with the necessary tidal/topographic/population combinations.

*the round trip efficiency of which is quite astounding, better than 80%.
